info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 13 at 12:57AM EDT until May 13 at 7:00AM EDT by NWS Blacksburg VA
info.description:
* WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of northwest North Carolina, including the following counties, Ashe and Watauga.
* WHEN...Until 700 AM EDT Tuesday.
* IMPACTS...Flooding along the New River and its tributaries and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding, this includes highway 88 near Clifton. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1256 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain. Flooding is already occurring in the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - This includes the following streams and drainages... Call Creek, Cut Laurel Creek, Big Horse Creek, Beaverdam Creek, Big Laurel Creek, Cove Creek, Brushy Fork and Beaver Creek. Additional rainfall amounts of 1 to 2 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Boone, Jefferson, West Jefferson, Lansing, Todd, Ashland and Deep Gap. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
When it is safe to do so, please send your reports of flooding, including mudslides or flooded roads, to the National Weather Service by calling toll free at 1...8 6 6...2 1 5...4 3 2 4. Reports and pictures can also be shared on the National Weather Service Blacksburg Facebook page and on Twitter.

parameter.value: FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 AM EDT THIS MORNING
